title: 108_hr2472
content: The Act titled "District of Columbia Budget Autonomy Act of 2003" amends Section 446 of the District of Columbia Home Rule Act regarding the enactment of the local budget. The Council must adopt the annual budget for the District of Columbia government within 50 days of receiving the proposal from the Mayor. Any supplements must also be adopted after a public hearing. In control years, the budget must be submitted to the President for transmission to Congress, following specific procedures outlined in the Act. The Mayor must transmit the budget to Congress after completion of budget procedures. No unauthorized obligations or expenditures can be made by District of Columbia government officials without approval by the Council and transmission of the Act to Congress. No amount can be spent by District of Columbia government officials without approval by the Council and transmission of the Act to Congress. Reprogramming of budget amounts requires Mayor's request and Council approval after annual budget adoption. After the annual budget adoption, reprogramming of budget amounts in the District of Columbia requires the Mayor to submit a request to the Council for approval. Any additional expenditures must be offset by reductions in expenditures for another activity. Additionally, the length of the Congressional review period for budget acts is extended by amending section 602(c) of the District of Columbia Financial Responsibility and Management Assistance Act of 1995. The Financial Responsibility and Management Assistance Act of 1995 is amended to extend the Congressional review period for budget acts. If no joint resolution disapproving the Act is enacted within a 30-day period, it will take effect. The Financial Responsibility and Management Assistance Act of 1995 is amended to extend the Congressional review period for budget acts. If no joint resolution disapproving the Act is enacted within a 30-day period, it will take effect unless extended for 5 additional days under certain circumstances. The Financial Responsibility and Management Assistance Act of 1995 is amended to extend the Congressional review period for budget acts. If no joint resolution disapproving the Act is enacted within a 30-day period, it will take effect unless extended for 5 additional days under certain circumstances. Conforming amendments are made to various sections of the Act. Conforming amendments are made to various sections of the Financial Responsibility and Management Assistance Act of 1995, including changes to sections 467(d), 471(c), 472(d)(2), 475(e)(2), and 483(d), among others. These changes involve replacing specific references with updated language, such as replacing "The fourth sentence of section 446" with "Section 446(c)". The Responsibility and Management Assistance Act of 1995 and the National Capital Revitalization Act of 1997 are amended to update references to section 446. The table of contents is also amended to reflect these changes. SEC. 3. Action by Council of District of Columbia on line-item vetoes by Mayor of provisions of budget acts. Section 404(f) of the District of Columbia Home Rule Act is amended to change the wording regarding transmission of items to the President. Additionally, a conforming amendment is made to clarify terminology and definitions within the subsection. In Section 404(f) of the District of Columbia Home Rule Act, amendments are made to clarify terminology and definitions. This includes changing wording related to the transmission of items to the President and adding a new paragraph defining the term 'control year'. SEC. 4 of the District of Columbia Home Rule Act is amended to allow employees to be hired if the position is authorized by the Council. SEC. 5 includes other amendments related to changes in the federal role in the budget process. The District of Columbia Home Rule Act is amended to give federal authority over the budget-making process during control years. Restrictions are placed on approving budgets that are not consistent with the financial plan. The term "control year" is defined in the Act. The District of Columbia Home Rule Act is amended to give federal authority over the budget-making process during control years, with restrictions on approving budgets not consistent with the financial plan. The term "control year" is defined in the Act as per section 305(4) of the District of Columbia Financial Responsibility and Management Assistance Act of 1995. SEC. 6. CONTINUATION OF GENERAL PROVISIONS IN APPROPRIATIONS ACTS. Any general provision in a general appropriation bill regarding Federal payments to the District of Columbia will remain in effect until the enactment of a new bill for the following fiscal year. SEC. 7. EFFECTIVE DATE. The amendments apply to District of Columbia budgets starting from October 1, 2004.
